body.name: Redragon M686 Wireless Gaming Mouse, 16000 DPI Wired/Wireless Gamer Mouse with Professional Sensor, 45-Hour Durable Power Capacity, Customizable Macro and RGB Backlight for PC/Mac/Laptop

features: Wireless for Boundless Wins - Cables really do affect the accurate battle reaction, Redragon M686 wireless gaming mouse with 2.4Ghz dongle frees you. It aims to offer the purest mouse moving experience helping you get that KDA up again.

Acme Adjustable DPI to 16000 - Geared with 5 onboard DPI levels (1000/2000/4000/8000/16000) which allow your mouse movements to be registered to pinpoint accuracy. Each of the 5 DPI levels is easily customizable via software, enabling you to switch to your DPI settings on the fly.

Easy Keybinding with Macro - 8 programmable buttons are all editable with customizable tactical keybinds in whatever game or work you are engaging. Also equipped with 3 side macro buttons make for better gaming and workplace experience.

Ultra Long-lasting Core - Equipped with the PAW3335 Optical Pixart sensor, the mouse consumption is greatly reduced with 1000Hz Polling Rate in dual mode. Coupled with a durable rechargeable battery, the mouse will keep you gaming for up to 45 hours (eco-mode)!

Adjustable True Color - The Redragon Pro driver enables you to show your style with endless possibilities like dynamic streaming, breathing, glowing, with various lighting modes to light up your room giving you that in-game competitive vibe.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Dual-mode, go for the win 1000 Hz Polling Rate with 40G acceleration can be activated in any mode, take your shot with precise timing to victory. Wireless freedom, You're in control Advanced 2.4Ghz dongle with 1ms polling report rate giving you that same 1ms(1000Hz) as USB in wired mode. You won't waste a single millisecond! Ergonomic, never felt so good Snug right-hand grip design with skin-friendly finish, keeps your hand clean with less fatigue after a long gaming or work session.
Ultra-Precise 16000 DPI Movement 5 DPI Levels Free to Adjust by ± 100 Won't waste a millisecond with registration to each pinpoint location

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Feels great, easily transported
reviews.reviewText: Needed a mouse for a new laptop. Charges with a USB Type-C, has an eco mode and an on mode. Has cool colors if that's your thing. Works well if in eco mode, if you forget to turn it off when it's on "on" mode the battery does drain kinda quickly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great mid-tier mouse
reviews.reviewText: I had the old version of this, lasted 3 1/2 years until the middle mouse button started failing. This new one feels great, has three macros for the thumb, and a dpi toggle built in. Battery life is about average, but I keep the included USB-C cable ran nearby. Mouse works great both wired and wirelessly. I'm sure in the $100+ range you'll find better mice, for this price I'm happy with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wireless Warrior Wins Every Time
reviews.reviewText: Let's be real, wired mice are a hassle. They snag on everything, yank your laptop across the desk, and basically scream "amateur hour." That's why I finally caved and snagged this wireless wonder from Redragon – and let me tell you, it's a game-changer.This little beast glides like a dream, thanks to the super smooth wireless connection. Whether I'm battling bosses in my latest RPG or editing like a madman, it keeps up flawlessly. The battery life is insane too – I've been using it for weeks without even a hint of needing a recharge. Plus, the customizable RGB lights? Total bonus points for deskside ambience.One night, I was in the middle of a crucial raid, heart pounding, when my old mouse went kaput. My party was counting on me, and I was panicking. Thankfully, I had this Redragon mouse prepped and ready to go. I plugged it in, adjusted the DPI with a quick button press (lightning-fast responsiveness!), and BAM – back in the fight, dominating like never before. We cleared the raid, and my party hailed me as the hero with the clutch wireless mouse. True story.So, if you're tired of tangled wires and finicky mice, do yourself a favor and grab this Redragon. It's a wireless win in every way.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works well, but a I'd change a couple of things
reviews.reviewText: Works well, feels good, no significant delay when in wireless mode. Need more tension on the middle mouse button scroll function (too easy to scroll if just bumped, when can put you into the position of changing weapons right at the worst time.) Also, too easy to push the rearmost programmable button on the left side; I've had to set that to some innocuous function rather than use to advantage.Overall, though, I'm very pleased at what I get for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable on the hand, and smooth on the screen
reviews.reviewText: I have large hands and this fits it great. It works just as advertised and I think the battery life is as good as could be expected. If it starts flashing and the battery is low, just plug it up and keep right on working.The programmable buttons are great. With the work I do, copy and paste are used a lot. I have my keyboard as F2-Select All, F3-Copy, F4 Paste. I changed the raise and lower DPI buttons behind the wheel to copy and paste. Now and I do it without the keyboard. I moved the raise and lower DPI to beside my thumb behind the front button on the side which is Select All now. This mouse might now be for everyone, but it's worth checking out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Wireless Mouse for its price!
reviews.reviewText: First of all I was surprised with the quality of this mouse for its price. It feels comfortable to use for extended periods of time ( my hand is a medium to large size hand), has some heft to it , and doesn't seem as flimsy as other wireless mice. The layout of the buttons on the mouse are well placed overall with an exception to the front left mouse button that seems to be placed slightly too much forward . (although this may differ depending on your hand size). Battery life is good and gets me thru a days worth of use without having to recharge.The Red dragon software for this mouse feels well made, intuitive and has the awesome feature of creating macros and reassigning the extra buttons on the mouse. Aesthetically speaking the mouse looks sleek and gives you good control on the lighting pattern of the mouse that ranges from full on RGB mode to a cool breathing effect.The only bad thing about this mouse is the slot on the bottom of the mouse for storing the USB dongle. It felt a bit loose and is not flush with the bottom surface of the mouse making it susceptible to being lost. Perhaps in the next version this issue could be addressed.Overall, I'd say this mouse is a great choice for anybody looking for an inexpensive wireless mouse for their work or gaming setups. I give this mouse a 4.5/5 for its great features, ergonomics, and style.Pros:- Great Ergonomics ( Medium to large size hands)- Button layout- Program's ease of use- Battery Lasts multiple daysCons- The USB dongle slot on the mouse

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This gaming mouse is very good with a lot of different settings to improve perfomance, but unafortunately is too big for my hand and it end up being a little uncomfortable for casual use
I'm super happy with it, it feels good, performs well, lasts long between charges and looks great. I have no complaints with this mouse, it is exactly what I was looking for.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The mouse is very comfortable and as soon as you plug it in it’s good to go, dpi settings can be changed without the paired software.Gave 4 stars because unfortunately this software is inaccessible to mac users, so the advanced settings in the software for this mouse cannot be done on a macOS. I didn’t read the full description about this since the title of the product says for PC/Mac… etc.
Va molt bé i és molt ergonòmic

Pros +Designen är perfekt för de som gillar pinkyrest och den är grymt bekväm.Trådlös, för de som vill ha en Mionix men utan sladd.Cons -Känns plastig och är lite för lätt men det går att avhjälpa med rätt musmatta.
